intro: Comocladia jamaicensis, commonly known as Jamaican evergreen, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Lygneraceae. It is native to the Caribbean, particularly Jamaica, and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and evergreen foliage. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in coastal areas and disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in local ecosystems and horticulture.
